summary: This bill, the "Moving H–2A to United States Department of Agriculture Act of 2025," proposes to transfer the administration of the H-2A visa program (for temporary agricultural workers) from the Secretary of Labor to the Secretary of Agriculture. It also shifts the oversight role from the Attorney General to the Secretary of Homeland Security. The changes are slated to take effect 60 days after the bill's enactment, along with the transfer of necessary resources.
